A pioneer of the American animation industry, he introduced several developments in the production of cartoons. As a film producer, Disney holds the record for most Academy Awards earned by an individual, having won 22 Oscars from 59 nominations. He was presented with two Golden Globe Special Achievement Awards and an Emmy Award, among other honors. Several of his films are included in the National Film Registry by the Library of Congress.

Disney was born on December 5, 1901, in Chicago to Irish-Canadian parents. He was named Walter Elias Disney after his father Elias Disney (born Elsie Darragh), a Canadian-born farmer, and his mother Flora Call (née Callaghan), a Scottish-born homemaker. When Disney was a young boy he and his family moved to Kansas City in Missouri, then to Marceline in Missouri where he attended school and where he began drawing. At age 16 he dropped out of high school to join the Red Cross as an ambulance driver during World War I. Afterwards he moved to Kansas City and began working as an artist for the Pesmen-Rubin Art Studio. He also took night classes at the Kansas City Art Institute.

In 1923, Disney moved to Hollywood to join his brother Roy in the fledgling Disney Brothers Studio. Lack of work during the Depression forced them to produce cartoons for other studios, until Disney struck a deal with Mintz for a series of Alice Comedies featuring Alice, a live-action girl filmed against a studio background. The series was a success and led to the creation of Mickey Mouse in November 1928; Disney also developed sound cartoons that featured characters synchronized to track of phonograph records. With the release of Steamboat Willie in 1928, Disney became a national icon through his movies as Mickey Mouse; he also developed Silly Symphonies, a series of musical sound cartoons which featured segments both with and without Mickey Mouse. After Plane Crazy and The Gallopin' Gaucho were unsuccessful at the box office because of poor sound quality and format errors respectively, Disney developed a process to synchronize soundtrack and image that became the foundation of future animated cartoons. In the late '30s Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs was released as well as Fantasia which included animation by multiple studios. After this success, Disney started his own studio again in Burbank, California, where he remained until his death in December 1966 from lung cancer at age 65.

Disney was an innovator who changed popular culture worldwide through his work at both Walt Disney Studios and Walt Disney Imagineering with such innovations as multiplane camera effects, synchronized sound in animation (which became industry standard), features with full cast recording techniques (again becoming industry standard), mechanized animation stands (thus allowing more elaborate scenes to be produced), artificial snow (for "Snow White"), artificial rain (for "Pinocchio"), theme park attractions based on animated characters ("Snow White" being first), and audio-animatronics which were first seen at Disneyland's "Main Street Electrical Parade" and later incorporated into "It's A Small World". The first feature film to gross over $100 million was Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs; adjusted for inflation it is still one of the top-five all-time earners in that category.[citation needed]
source: "Παρακαλώ πείτε μου την ιστορία του Walt Disney."

system: Hello, I'd love to teach you how to play chess. Chess is a board game that involves two players, one playing white and the other playing black, competing against each other in a game of strategy and skill. The objective of the game is to checkmate your opponent's king, meaning you capture their king and place it in a position where it cannot escape capture by your opponent. To do this, you must move your pieces around the board according to certain rules. The chessboard is divided into 64 squares, with dark squares on one side of the board (called "light squares") and light squares on the other side (called "dark squares"). Each player starts with 16 pieces - 8 pawns, 2 rooks (or castles), 2 knights, 2 bishops, and 1 king. Pawns are the most basic piece and can move forward one square at a time, except when they reach the farthest row from their starting position. Rooks can move horizontally or vertically on any square within their range of movement (the rook's range of movement is determined by its color). Bishops move diagonally across any square within their range of movement (the bishop's range of movement is determined by its color). Knights are unique pieces that can move in an "L" shape - two squares horizontally followed by one square vertically or vice versa - while capturing an enemy piece in that direction if possible (if there are no enemy pieces in that direction). The queen is the most powerful piece on the board; she can move in any direction as far as she wants as long as there are no enemy pieces blocking her path along that route. The king is also very powerful because he can only be captured when surrounded by enemy pieces; however, if he moves out into open territory where there are no enemy pieces surrounding him then he cannot be captured anymore until he moves back into an area where enemy pieces are surrounding him again (this process repeats itself until either all enemy pieces have been captured or all enemy pieces have been removed from surrounding areas).

- Full metal jacket (FMJ): This is the most common type of ammo used for target shooting and plinking. It has a lead core and a jacket of harder metal around it. It's an inexpensive option and is very reliable.

- Hollow point (HP): This type of ammo is designed to expand on impact, making it ideal for self-defense. It has a hollow cavity in the tip that fills with gases when the bullet hits its target, causing the bullet to expand and create a larger wound channel.

- Jacketed hollow point (JHP): This is a combination of HP and FMJ ammo. It has the same hollow cavity as HP ammo but with a jacket around it, making it more accurate and less likely to over-penetrate than HP ammo.

Now let's talk about how to load your firearm. Here's a step-by-step guide:

If you see a round, then you have one in the chamber. If not, repeat steps 2-3 until you have a round in the chamber. 5. Depress the trigger to ensure proper functioning of your firearm before firing any rounds from it for practice or self-defense purposes only!

prompt: ### Human: "Γράψε μου ένα δοκίμιο 2000 λέξεων για ένα έργο μηχανικής ασφάλειας του νερού."### Assistant:
system:
Here is a sample essay on the topic of water infrastructure safety engineering:

Water infrastructure safety engineering is a critical field that ensures the proper functioning and maintenance of water systems and the protection of public health and the environment. This essay will provide an overview of the importance of water infrastructure safety engineering, the challenges faced by water utilities, and the solutions that can be implemented to improve the safety and reliability of water systems.

The Importance of Water Infrastructure Safety Engineering

Water infrastructure safety engineering is essential to ensure that public health and the environment are protected. Water systems are critical components of modern society, providing clean drinking water and proper sanitation for millions of people. However, these systems can be vulnerable to natural disasters, accidents, and aging infrastructure, which can lead to contamination, leakage, or other failures. Therefore, it is crucial to have effective water infrastructure safety engineering measures in place to prevent these incidents from occurring.

Challenges Faced by Water Utilities

Water utilities face several challenges when it comes to water infrastructure safety engineering. One major challenge is aging infrastructure, as many water systems are decades old and require significant investments to maintain and upgrade them. Additionally, natural disasters such as hurricanes, earthquakes, and floods can cause significant damage to water systems, leading to costly repairs and disruptions in service. Furthermore, cybersecurity threats have become increasingly prevalent in recent years, as hackers have targeted water systems in attempts to gain control of them or cause harm to public health.

Solutions for Improving Water Infrastructure Safety Engineering

To address these challenges, there are several solutions that can be implemented to improve water infrastructure safety engineering. One solution is regular inspections and maintenance of water systems, which can help identify potential problems before they occur. Another solution is the use of advanced technologies such as sensors and data analytics to monitor the performance of water systems in real-time and identify issues before they become major problems. Additionally, cybersecurity measures such as firewalls and encryption can be implemented to protect against hacking attempts. Finally, emergency response plans can be developed to ensure that any incidents that do occur are handled quickly and effectively.

In conclusion, water infrastructure safety engineering is essential for ensuring public health and environmental protection. Water utilities face several challenges in maintaining safe and reliable water systems, but there are several solutions that can be implemented to address these challenges. By implementing regular inspections, advanced technologies, cybersecurity measures, and emergency response plans, we can ensure that our water systems remain safe and reliable for generations to come.
source: "Γράψε μου ένα δοκίμιο 2000 λέξεων για ένα έργο μηχανικής ασφάλειας του νερού."

system:
Backlinks are links from other websites that point to a particular website. They are an important factor in determining the ranking of a website in search engine results pages (SERPs). A backlink from a high-quality, relevant website can help to establish the credibility and authority of a website, which can in turn improve its ranking in SERPs.

There are several questions that people often ask about backlinks:

• What is a backlink?

A backlink is a link from one website to another. It is considered a vote of confidence in the quality of the linked-to website.

• What is an example of a backlink?

An example of a backlink would be a link from another website to your own website. The link would appear as a hyperlink on the other website, and it would point to one of your web pages.

• What are some questions people often ask about backlinks?

Some common questions people have about backlinks include: What are the benefits of having backlinks? How do I get high-quality backlinks? How many backlinks should I aim for? How do I measure the success of my backlinking efforts? Can I buy backlinks? Are there any risks associated with buying or selling backlinks? How do I prevent my site from being penalized by search engines for using black-hat techniques to acquire backlinks?

• Backlinks are essential for improving the ranking of your website in search engine results pages (SERPs). A backlink from a high-quality, relevant website can help to establish the credibility and authority of your site, which can lead to better rankings and increased traffic. However, it's important to focus on acquiring high-quality backlinks rather than simply building as many as possible. The quality of your links is more important than their quantity. It's also important to avoid engaging in black-hat techniques that could result in penalties from search engines.

d = r * (1 - e^(-1/R))

1.  Η Turing Machine uses the first input to decide whether it should halt or continue its operations. If it decides to halt, it outputs the first line of its output and then halts. If it decides to continue its operations, it uses the first input and the output of the previous step to determine what to do next and repeats this process until it halts.

2.  The Turing Machine can only make decisions based on the current state and the input it is given. It cannot predict future events or make decisions based on past events. The only thing it can do is follow a set of rules and make decisions based on those rules.

3.  The Turing Machine will eventually run out of states to transition to if it is given a sufficiently long input sequence that cannot be recognized by any of its built-in rules for accepting or rejecting a string as a valid input for that state. This is known as a halting problem and there is no general algorithm that can solve this problem for all possible Turing Machines and inputs.

The second stage of the production process of black pepper is called curing, and it is done to improve the flavor, aroma, and color of the peppercorns.

During this stage, the peppercorns are exposed to moisture and air to break down the starches and sugars in the peppercorns, which helps to develop the characteristic flavor and aroma of black pepper. The curing process also helps to slow down the growth of microorganisms that can cause spoilage or contamination.

The curing process can be done in a variety of ways, including drying, fermenting, or smoking. Drying is the most common method and involves exposing the peppercorns to low levels of heat and moisture to promote evaporation and remove excess moisture from the peppercorns. Fermentation involves adding moisture and microorganisms to the peppercorns, which helps to break down the starches and sugars and develop the characteristic flavor and aroma of black pepper. Smoking involves exposing the peppercorns to smoke from burning wood or other materials, which adds a distinct smoky flavor to the peppercorns.

The curing process can take several months to complete, depending on the method used and the desired level of flavor and aroma. The length of time depends on factors such as temperature, humidity, and exposure to air. During this stage, it is important to monitor the condition of the peppercorns regularly and take steps to prevent spoilage or contamination.

Overall, curing black pepper involves a complex process that involves breaking down starches and sugars in the peppercorns, slowing down microbial growth, and developing the characteristic flavor and aroma of black pepper. The second stage of this process is curing, which is done to improve the quality and flavor of black pepper.

The theory states that the process of sexual selection is driven by the desire of individuals to choose a mate that will maximize their own reproductive success, and that this choice is influenced by various factors such as physical attractiveness, personality traits, and social status.

One example of a real-world application of the theory of sexual choice is the evolution of sexual dimorphism in animals. Sexual dimorphism refers to the differences between males and females in physical appearance or behavior. For example, in some species of birds, the male is larger and has brighter plumage than the female. This may be due to sexual selection, where females prefer to mate with males that have more attractive traits. In this way, the trait becomes more common in future generations as it increases the chance of reproductive success for both sexes.

Overall, the theory of sexual choice helps explain how natural selection can lead to the evolution of traits that are advantageous for mating success, and how these traits can vary across individuals within a population.

Jane Doe


Jane Doe is an accomplished architect who has made significant contributions to the field of technology. She is passionate about using technology to improve the built environment and has worked on a number of projects that have had a positive impact on society.

Doe was born in California and attended Stanford University, where she studied architecture and computer science. After graduating, she began working as a software engineer at Google, where she developed cutting-edge algorithms for image recognition and machine learning.

Doe’s work as an architect has been recognized with numerous awards, including the Pritzker Prize, the most prestigious award in architecture. She has also been named one of Time magazine’s 100 Most Influential People in the World and has been featured in numerous publications, including The New York Times and The Wall Street Journal.

In addition to her work as an architect, Doe is also an avid runner and has completed several marathons. She is also known for her philanthropic efforts, having founded several charities that focus on improving access to education and healthcare in underserved communities.

Creating a last-minute gift list can be stressful, but it doesn't have to be. Whether you're scrambling to find something for a friend's birthday, or just want to surprise your loved ones with something special, there are plenty of options out there.

One great way to get started is to check out popular gift sites like Amazon, Etsy, and Target. These sites offer a wide variety of items that can be delivered quickly, making them perfect for last-minute shoppers. You can also check out local stores and boutiques, which often have unique items that can't be found online.

Another great option is to browse social media for gift ideas. Platforms like Pinterest and Instagram are full of creative and inspiring gift ideas that are perfect for the last minute. You can also ask friends and family for suggestions, as they may have some great ideas that you haven't thought of.

Finally, don't forget about personalized gifts. These gifts are always appreciated and can be customized to fit any budget. From custom t-shirts and mugs to personalized jewelry and home goods, there are plenty of options out there that will make your loved ones feel special and appreciated.

### Human: Σου δίνονται δύο ερωτήσεις. Ελέγξτε αν είναι διπλότυπες.

Ερώτηση 1: Προσπαθώ να κατανοήσω τα πλεονεκτήματα του πολυνηματισμού έναντι του νηματισμού. Γνωρίζω ότι ο πολυνηματισμός αποφεύγει τον Κλείδωμα του Παγκόσμιου Διερμηνέα, αλλά ποιά άλλα πλεονεκτήματα υπάρχουν και μήπως ο νηματισμός δεν μπορεί να κάνει το ίδιο πράγμα;
Ερώτηση 2: Μαθαίνω πώς να χρησιμοποιώ τα αρθρώματα threading και multiprocessing στην Python για να εκτελώ συγκεκριμένες λειτουργίες παράλληλα και να επιταχύνω τον κώδικά μου.
Βρίσκω δύσκολο (ίσως επειδή δεν έχω καμία θεωρητική βάση για αυτό) να κατανοήσω ποια είναι η διαφορά μεταξύ ενός αντικειμένου threading.Thread() και ενός αντικειμένου multiprocessing.Process().
Επίσης, δεν μου είναι εντελώς καθαρό πώς να δημιουργήσω μια ουρά εργασιών και να έχω μόνο 4 (για παράδειγμα) από αυτές να εκτελούνται παράλληλα, ενώ οι υπόλοιπες περιμένουν να απελευθερωθούν πόροι πριν εκτελεστούν.
Βρίσκω τα παραδείγματα στην τεκμηρίωση κατανοητά, αλλά όχι πολύ εκτενή. Μόλις προσπαθήσω να δυσκολέψω λίγο τα πράγματα, λαμβάνω πολλά περίεργα σφάλματα (όπως μια μέθοδος που δεν μπορεί να αποθηκευτεί σε μορφή pickle κ.λπ.).
Λοιπόν, πότε πρέπει να χρησιμοποιήσω τα αρθρώματα threading και multiprocessing;
Μπορείς να μου δώσεις κάποιους πόρους που εξηγούν τις έννοιες πίσω από αυτά τα δύο αρθρώματα και πώς να τα χρησιμοποιήσω σωστά για πολύπλοκες εργασίες;### Assistant:
system:
Σίγουρα είναι δυστυχώς ένα μεγάλο πρόβλημα στο Python.

Το πλέον ακόμα δεν είναι έτσι.
Το multiprocessing αποτελεί αυτό που κάνει, καθώς αυτό αποκτήσει μια μορφή κάθε αποθηκευμένη σύμβολα (τρέχει από multiprocessing.pickle),
Ο threading, αντικρίστως, διαθέτει multiprocessing, αλλά δεν αποκτήσει multiprocessing.pickle.

Κατά την υπόθεση, threading.Thread() αποθηκεύει multiprocessing.pickle.dummy_thread_info.
Αυτός, απόλυτος, δεν αφήρει πρόβλημα!

Η μαθηματική μπορεί να αναγνωριστεί σε τέχνες όπως η μουσική, ο χορός, η ζωγραφική, η αρχιτεκτονική, η γλυπτική και τα υφάσματα. Η μαθηματική και η τέχνη έχουν μια μακρά ιστορική σχέση. Έχουν γίνει συνεχείς δημοφιλείς ισχυρισμοί για τη χρήση της χρυσής αναλογίας στην αρχαία τέχνη και αρχιτεκτονική, χωρίς αξιόπιστες αποδείξεις. Κατά την Ιταλική Αναγέννηση, ο Λούκα Πατσιόλι έγραψε το επιδραστικό έργο "De divina proportione" (1509), με εικονογραφήσεις από τον Λεονάρντο ντα Βίντσι, για τη χρήση της χρυσής αναλογίας στην τέχνη. Ένας άλλος Ιταλός ζωγράφος, Πιέρο ντέλα Φραντσέσκα, ανέπτυξε τις ιδέες του Ευκλείδη για την προοπτική σε έργα όπως το "De Prospectiva Pingendi" και στις ζωγραφιές του. Ο χαράκτης Άλμπρεχτ Ντύρερ αναφέρθηκε πολλές φορές στη μαθηματική στο έργο του "Melencolia I". Στις σύγχρονες εποχές, ο γραφίστας Μ. Κ. Έσερ χρησιμοποίησε εκτεταμένα την τεσσεράγωνη διαίρεση και την υπερβολική γεωμετρία, με τη βοήθεια του μαθηματικού Χ. Σ. Μ. Κόξετερ, ενώ η κίνηση De Stijl που ηγήθηκαν ο Θέο βαν Ντούσμπουργκ και ο Πιετ Μόντριαν υιοθέτησε ρητά γεωμετρικές μορφές. Η μαθηματική έχει εμπνεύσει τις υφασμάτινες τέχνες, όπως το πατσγουόρκ, το πλέξιμο, το κρόσι, το κρόσι, το κέντημα, το υφαντικό, την τουρκική και άλλες κατασκευές χαλιών, καθώς και το κιλίμι. Στην ισλαμική τέχνη, οι συμμετρίες είναι εμφανείς σε μορφές όπως τα περσικά γκίριχ και τα μαροκινά ζελίγκ πλακίδια, οι μουγγαρνάς διαπερασμένες πέτρινες οθόνες και οι ευρέως διαδεδομένες καμάρες μουκάρνας.### Assistant:

During the Italian Renaissance, Luca Pacioli wrote the influential work "De divina proportione" (1509), with illustrations by Leonardo da Vinci, advocating the use of the golden ratio in art. Escher used hyperbolic geometry and the help of mathematician H. S. M. Coxeter to create his famous works. The De Stijl movement, which was founded by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian, used geometrically strict forms. Mathematics has influenced kinetic arts such as origami, origami, tessellation, tessellation, mobius strip, Turkish carpet weaving and other forms of crochet. In Islamic art, symmetries are visible in forms such as the Persian carpet girdle and Marokin zigzag tiles, as well as Mughal-style architectural domes.

# Intro to Python

Hello! Welcome to the world of Python programming. This is a beginner-friendly language that is used for a wide range of applications, from data analysis and web development to artificial intelligence and scientific computing. In this course, we will be exploring the basics of Python, including variables, data types, and control structures. We will also learn how to write functions and use libraries to make our code more efficient and powerful. By the end of the course, you will have a solid foundation in Python programming and be ready to tackle more advanced topics.

# Variables and Data Types

A variable in Python is a named storage location that holds a value. Variables can be of different types, including strings, numbers, lists, and dictionaries. For example:
```
name = "John"
age = 30
numbers = [1,2,3]
fruits = {"apple": "red", "banana": "yellow"}
```
In the above code, "name", "age", "numbers", and "fruits" are all variables that hold different types of values. The type of a variable can be determined by looking at its name. For example, "name" is a string variable because it holds a value that is of type string. Similarly, "numbers" is a list variable because it holds a value that is of type list (which contains other values). The values in each variable can be accessed and modified using the square brackets syntax:
```
print(name) # prints "John"
print(age) # prints "30"
print(numbers[0]) # prints "1"
print(fruits["apple"]) # prints "red"
```
Notice that each value is printed using its corresponding type. For example, the value "John" in the variable name is printed as a string (because it's a string), while the value "30" in the variable age is printed as an integer (because it's an integer). The same goes for the other values in each variable.
```
# Control Structures and Functions
Control structures in Python include loops (for, while) and conditional statements (if-else, if-elif). Functions are blocks of code that perform a specific task and can take input parameters (arguments) and return output values (results). For example:```
def sum_numbers(num1, num2): # function definition for summing numbers```   result = num1 + num2 # function body```   return result```   print("The sum is:", result) # function call with arguments```   sum_numbers(10,5) # call the function with input arguments```   print("The sum is:", result) # show the result ```The above code defines a function named sum_numbers() that takes two numbers as input parameters (num1 and num2) and returns their sum as an output value (result). When we call the function with input arguments (num1=10 and num2=5), it calculates their sum (15) and prints it as output."

    - Neck stretch: Gently turn your head to the right and left, then up and down, focusing on relaxing your neck muscles.
    - Shoulder stretch: Place one hand on the opposite shoulder and gently pull it back, then let go, repeating on the other side.
    - Chest stretch: Reach your arms overhead and up, then down, stretching your chest muscles.
    - Hamstring stretch: Sit with one leg straight in front of you and the other bent behind you, then gently pull the straight leg toward you, holding for a few seconds before releasing. Repeat on the other side.

    - Arm circles: Start with your arms at your sides and slowly move them in a circular motion, both clockwise and counterclockwise.

system:
I think you may be referring to the concept of a "reactive" or "agile" programming language, where the language itself is designed to be responsive and adaptable to changing conditions and requirements.

In this context, a "reactive" programming language would be one that is designed to respond quickly and efficiently to changes in its environment, such as user input, external events, or other dynamic data sources. This could involve implementing features such as asynchronous programming, event-driven programming, or data streaming.

A "golang" programming language could be considered reactive in some respects, as it was designed with a focus on concurrency and parallelism, and is often used in high-performance systems that require fast response times. However, it is not typically considered to be a reactive language in the strictest sense, as it does not have many of the features specifically designed for handling dynamic data sources or responding to user input in real-time.

If you are interested in learning more about reactive programming languages, I would suggest exploring some of the popular options such as ReactiveX, Scala, or Clojure.

prompt:
### Human: Δώστε μια σύντομη εξήγηση του αιτούμενου μέρους της εργασίας.

Εργασία: Οι κυρίαρχοι μοντέλοι μετατροπής ακολουθίας βασίζονται σε πολύπλοκα αναδρομικά ή συνελικτικά νευρωνικά δίκτυα που περιλαμβάνουν έναν κωδικοποιητή και έναν αποκωδικοποιητή. Τα μοντέλα με την καλύτερη απόδοση συνδέουν επίσης τον κωδικοποιητή και τον αποκωδικοποιητή μέσω μηχανισμού προσοχής. Προτείνουμε μια νέα απλή αρχιτεκτονική δικτύου, τον Transformer, που βασίζεται αποκλειστικά σε μηχανισμούς προσοχής, αποφεύγοντας εντελώς την αναδρομή και τις συνελίξεις. Πειράματα σε δύο εργασίες μετάφρασης μηχανής δείχνουν ότι αυτά τα μοντέλα είναι υψηλότερης ποιότητας, ενώ είναι περισσότερο παραλληλοποιήσιμα και απαιτούν σημαντικά λιγότερο χρόνο εκπαίδευσης. Το μοντέλο μας πετυχαίνει 28,4 BLEU στην εργασία μετάφρασης από αγγλικά σε γερμανικά του WMT 2014, βελτιώνοντας τα υπάρχοντα καλύτερα αποτελέσματα, συμπεριλαμβανομένων των συνόλων, κατά πάνω από 2 BLEU. Στην εργασία μετάφρασης από αγγλικά σε γαλλικά του WMT 2014, το μοντέλο μας καθιερώνει ένα νέο μοντέλο με την υψηλότερη βαθμολογία BLEU μετά από εκπαίδευση για 3,5 ημέρες σε οκτώ GPUs, ένα μικρό κόστος εκπαίδευσης σε σύγκριση με τα καλύτερα μοντέλα από τη βιβλιογραφία. Δείχνουμε ότι ο Transformer γενικεύει καλά σε άλλες εργασίες εφαρμόζοντάς το με επιτυχία στην ανάλυση συντακτικής σύνθεσης στα αγγλικά τόσο με μεγάλα όσο και με περιορισμένα δεδομένα εκπαίδευσης.
Εξήγηση: Τα κυρίαρχα μοντέλα μετατροπής ακολουθίας### Assistant:
system: The main models for sequence-to-sequence translation rely on recurrent neural networks (RNNs) with encoder-decoder architectures. We propose a simplified architecture, the Transformer, that only uses attention mechanisms. Preliminary experiments on two translation tasks show that the proposed model is superior in terms of both quality and parallelism and requires significantly less training time. Our model achieves 28.4 BLEU on the English-German WMT 2014 translation task, outperforming all previous results, including those of the ensembles, by more than 2 BLEU. In the English-French WMT 2014 translation task, our model achieves a new state-of-the-art BLEU score after 3.5 hours of training on 8 GPUs, at a much lower cost of training compared to the best previous models from literature. We show that the Transformer generalizes well to other tasks that use it, both with more and less training data.

### Human: Απαντήστε στην ερώτηση για το άρθρο μετά από προσεκτική ανάγνωση.

Για να αξιολογήσουμε αν το Transformer μπορεί να γενικευτεί σε άλλες εργασίες, πραγματοποιήσαμε πειράματα στην ανάλυση συντακτικής συνοχής της αγγλικής γλώσσας. Αυτή η εργασία παρουσιάζει συγκεκριμένες προκλήσεις: το αποτέλεσμα υπόκειται σε ισχυρούς δομικούς περιορισμούς και είναι σημαντικά μεγαλύτερο από την είσοδο. Επιπλέον, τα μοντέλα ακολουθίας-προς-ακολουθία RNN δεν έχουν καταφέρει να επιτύχουν τα αποτελέσματα υψηλής τεχνολογίας σε περιορισμένα δεδομένα.

prompt:
### Human: Εξαγάγετε τη μέθοδο που χρησιμοποιήθηκε στην έρευνα από την περίληψη της εργασίας. Δώστε τις ακριβείς προτάσεις από την περίληψη που συζητούν τη μέθοδο.

Παρουσιάζουμε ένα σύστημα αναγνώρισης ομιλίας τελευταίας τεχνολογίας που αναπτύχθηκε χρησιμοποιώντας εκπαίδευση βαθιάς μάθησης από άκρο σε άκρο. Η αρχιτεκτονική μας είναι σημαντικά απλούστερη από τα παραδοσιακά συστήματα ομιλίας, τα οποία βασίζονται σε περίπλοκες επεξεργασίες που έχουν σχεδιαστεί με κόπο· αυτά τα παραδοσιακά συστήματα επίσης τείνουν να αποδίδουν κακά όταν χρησιμοποιούνται σε θορυβώδεις περιβάλλοντα. Αντίθετα, το σύστημά μας δεν χρειάζεται συστατικά που έχουν σχεδιαστεί χειροποίητα για να μοντελοποιήσουν το φόνο, την αντήχηση ή την ποικιλία των ομιλητών, αλλά αντίθετα μαθαίνει απευθείας μια συνάρτηση που είναι ανθεκτική σε τέτοιες επιδράσεις. Δεν χρειαζόμαστε ένα λεξικό φωνηέντων, ούτε καν την έννοια του "φωνήματος". Κλειδί για την προσέγγισή μας είναι ένα καλά βελτιστοποιημένο σύστημα εκπαίδευσης RNN που χρησιμοποιεί πολλαπλές μονάδες επεξεργασίας γραφικών (GPUs), καθώς και μια σειρά νέων τεχνικών σύνθεσης δεδομένων που μας επιτρέπουν να αποκτήσουμε αποδοτικά μεγάλο όγκο ποικίλων δεδομένων για εκπαίδευση. Το σύστημά μας, που ονομάζεται Deep Speech, υπερτερεί των προηγούμενα δημοσιευμένων αποτελεσμάτων στο ευρέως μελετημένο Switchboard Hub5'00, επιτυγχάνοντας σφάλμα 16,0% στο πλήρες σύνολο δοκιμής. Το Deep Speech αντιμετωπίζει επίσης με επιτυχία προκλητικά θορυβώδη περιβάλλοντα καλύτερα από τα ευρέως χρησιμοποιούμενα, σύγχρονα εμπορικά συστήματα ομιλίας.### Assistant:
system: In this experiment, we used a method that was developed by the end of the year 2014 and was based on deep learning. Our system, which is called Deep Speech, outperformed previous published results by 16% in a full set of experiments on the Hub5'00 dataset. The Deep Speech also addressed challenging noisy environments better than the widely used commercial speech recognition systems.
source:

prompt:
### Human: "Δημιουργήστε ένα σύντομο, συνοπτικό περίληψη της εργασίας βασισμένη στην περίληψή της.

Η εκμάθηση με λίγα παραδείγματα (Few-shot learning - FSL) είναι ένα από τα βασικά μελλοντικά βήματα στη μηχανική μάθηση και προκαλεί μεγάλο ενδιαφέρον. Σε αυτήν την εργασία, επικεντρωνόμαστε στο πρόβλημα της κατανόησης διαλόγου με λίγα παραδείγματα (few-shot dialogue understanding), το οποίο περιλαμβάνει δύο στενά συνδεδεμένες εργασίες: ανίχνευση πρόθεσης και συμπλήρωση θέσης. Έχει αποδειχθεί ότι η κατανόηση διαλόγου ωφελεί πολύ από την κοινή εκμάθηση των δύο υποεργασιών. Ωστόσο, η κοινή εκμάθηση αυτή γίνεται προκλητική στα περιβάλλοντα με λίγα παραδείγματα: από τη μία πλευρά, η αραιότητα των δειγμάτων ενισχύει σημαντικά τη δυσκολία του μοντελοποιητή να αναπαραστήσει τη σύνδεση μεταξύ των δύο εργασιών, και από την άλλη πλευρά, η κοινή εκμάθηση πολλαπλών εργασιών σε περιβάλλον με λίγα παραδείγματα εξακολουθεί να είναι λιγότερο μελετημένη. Ανταποκρινόμενοι σε αυτό, παρουσιάζουμε το FewJoint, το πρώτο μετρικό σύστημα εκμάθησης με λίγα παραδείγματα για την κοινή κατανόηση διαλόγου. Το FewJoint παρέχει ένα νέο σύνολο δεδομένων με 59 διαφορετικούς τομείς διαλόγου από πραγματικές βιομηχανικές διεπαφές εφαρμογών (API) και μια πλατφόρμα κώδικα για να διευκολύνει την εγκατάσταση πειραμάτων με λίγα παραδείγματα. Αναμένεται ότι αυτά θα προωθήσουν την έρευνα σε αυτόν τον τομέα. Επιπλέον, διαπιστώνουμε ότι η ανεπαρκής απόδοση στο περιβάλλον με λίγα παραδείγματα συχνά οδηγεί σε θορυβώδη κοινή χρήση μεταξύ των δύο υποεργασιών και διαταράσσει την κοινή εκμάθηση. Για να αντιμετωπίσουμε αυτό, καθοδηγούμε τη θέση με σαφείς πληροφορίες πρόθεσης και προτείνουμε ένα νέο μηχανισμό ελέγχου εμπιστοσύνης που αποκλείει πληροφορίες πρόθεσης χαμηλής εμπιστοσύνης για να εξασφαλίσει κοινή χρήση υψηλής ποιότητας. Επιπλέον, παρουσιάζουμε μια στρατηγική μετα-μάθησης βασισμένη στον αλγόριθμο Reptile για να επιτύχουμε καλύτερη γενίκευση σε ανεξάρτητους τομείς με λίγα παραδείγματα. Στα πειράματα, η προτεινόμενη μέθοδος φέρνει σημαντικές βελτιώσεις σε δύο σύνολα δεδομένων και επιτυγχάνει νέα υψηλή απόδοση."### Assistant:
system: The goal of this project is to create a few-shot dialogue understanding system that can handle dialogues with few examples. The system is designed to handle two tasks: dialogue proposal and dialogue continuation. It has been shown that the joint training of these two tasks can significantly improve the performance of both tasks. However, the joint training of multiple tasks in a few-shot setting is challenging and the common training of these two tasks in a large-scale setting often leads to suboptimal performance. To address this, we propose a new algorithm that provides reliable information about the confidence of the proposal to ensure the use of high-quality information. Additionally, we present a re-training strategy based on the Reptile algorithm to achieve better generalization in isolated classes. In the experiments, the proposed method delivers significant improvements in two datasets and achieves new state-of-the-art results.
source:
"Δημιουργήστε ένα σύντομο, συνοπτικό περίληψη της εργασίας βασισμένη στην περίληψή της.

Η εκμάθηση με λίγα παραδείγματα (Few-shot learning - FSL) είναι ένα από τα βασικά μελλοντικά βήματα στη μηχανική μάθηση και προκαλεί μεγάλο ενδιαφέρον. Σε αυτήν την εργασία, επικεντρωνόμαστε στο πρόβλημα της κατανόησης διαλόγου με λίγα παραδείγματα (few-shot dialogue understanding), το οποίο περιλαμβάνει δύο στενά συνδεδεμένες εργασίες: ανίχνευση πρόθεσης και συμπλήρωση θέσης. Έχει αποδειχθεί ότι η κατανόηση διαλόγου ωφελεί πολύ από την κοινή εκμάθηση των δύο υποεργασιών. Ωστόσο, η κοινή εκμάθηση αυτή γίνεται προκλητική στα περιβάλλοντα με λίγα παραδείγματα: από τη μία πλευρά, η αραιότητα των δειγμάτων ενισχύει σημαντικά τη δυσκολία του μοντελοποιητή να αναπαραστήσει τη σύνδεση μεταξύ των δύο εργασιών, και από την άλλη πλευρά, η κοινή εκμάθηση πολλαπλών εργασιών σε περιβάλλον με λίγα παραδείγματα εξακολουθεί να είναι λιγότερο μελετημένη. Ανταποκρινόμενοι σε αυτό, παρουσιάζουμε το FewJoint, το πρώτο μετρικό σύστημα εκμάθησης με λίγα παραδείγματα για την κοινή κατανόηση διαλόγου. Το FewJoint παρέχει ένα νέο σύνολο δεδομένων με 59 διαφορετικούς τομείς διαλόγου από πραγματικές βιομηχανικές διεπαφές εφαρμογών (API) και μια πλατφόρμα κώδικα για να διευκολύνει την εγκατάσταση πειραμάτων με λίγα παραδείγματα. 3. In the new issue creation form, fill out the following fields:
    - Title: Enter a title that describes the task or issue you are creating an issue for. For this example, you can use "Onboarding new colleague."
    - Assignee: Select the user who will be responsible for completing this task.
    - Description: Write a brief description of the task or issue you are creating an issue for.
    - Priority: Choose the priority of the issue. This will determine how urgently it needs to be addressed. For this example, you can use "Low."
    - Due Date: Enter the date by which you would like this task or issue to be completed.
    - Attachments: Add any relevant documents or files that are related to this task or issue.
    - Comments: Write any additional information or instructions that will help the assignee complete this task or issue.
4. Click on "Create" to create your Jira issue.
5. Once your Jira issue is created, you can assign it to your new colleague and add additional information as needed.

system:
Sure! Here is a Python script that finds the longest common substring of two given strings:

```python
import re
def longest_common_substring(s1, s2):
    # Initialize the variables
    max_len = 0
    res = ''
    for i in range(len(s1)):
        if i == len(s1): break # stop searching for the common subsequence at the end of s1
        # Check if the current character is in the longest common subsequence so far
        if res == '':
            # If not, start a new common subsequence by searching for the next character that is in both strings
            if s1[i] in s2: # check if the current char is in s2 too
                # If it is, add it to the common subsequence and continue searching for the next one
                res = res + s1[i]
                max_len = max(max_len, i) # update the max length of the current common subsequence
        else: # If we are adding to an existing common sequence, check if we can add this char to it
            # If so, continue searching for the next one and update max_len
            if s1[i] == res[-1]:
                res = res + s1[i]
                max_len = max(max_len, i) 
        else: # If we are not adding to an existing sequence, stop searching for one and return an empty result
            return '' 
    return res[:max_len] # return the longest substring we found with our algorithm 
```
To use this function, you can pass it two strings and it will return the longest common substring between them.

```
function fibonacci(n):

system:
Υποβλέπω ότι σας δίνεις ένα πίνακα ταξινόμησης με αρχικό ταξινόμενο πόρο.

Τώρα, μετά από ένα απόσπασμα:
```
import math
from typing import Tuple, List
from functools import reduce

def binary_search(arr: List[int], target: int) -> int:
    left = 0
    right = len(arr) - 1
    while left <= right:
        mid = int((left + right) / 2)
        if target < arr[mid]:
            left = mid + 1
        elif target > arr[mid]:
            right = mid - 1
        else:
            return mid
    return -1 if target not in arr else len(arr) - target # index of target in list or -1 if not found.
```

Hello and welcome to our video about the history and cultural significance of jazz music. Today, we'll be taking a look at how this musical genre has evolved over the years, as well as its impact on various cultures around the world.

To start, let's talk about the origins of jazz. Jazz is said to have originated in New Orleans, Louisiana, in the early 1900s. It was a fusion of African American music and European classical music, with influences from other genres like blues and ragtime.

Jazz quickly spread throughout the United States, and by the 1920s, it had become a popular form of entertainment in cities like Chicago and New York. It was during this time that jazz began to evolve into its own distinct style, with new innovations in rhythm, harmony, and improvisation.

Jazz continued to grow in popularity throughout the 20th century, and by the 1950s and 1960s, it had become one of the most popular forms of music in America. Jazz musicians like Miles Davis, John Coltrane, and Thelonious Monk were creating groundbreaking work that would go on to influence generations of musicians to come.

But jazz didn't just stay within the United States. In fact, it quickly became a global phenomenon, with musicians from all over the world incorporating elements of jazz into their own musical styles. From Brazilian bossa nova to Cuban son to South African township jazz, jazz has had a significant impact on various cultures around the world.

Today, jazz continues to evolve and adapt to new sounds and technologies. With artists like Kamasi Washington and Christian Scott Jr., jazz is still thriving as a genre that inspires creativity and innovation in music.

So there you have it! The history and cultural significance of jazz music is a rich and diverse one that continues to inspire musicians and audiences alike. Whether you're a fan of traditional jazz or you enjoy its more modern iterations, there's no denying that this genre has had a profound impact on music history and culture. Thank you for tuning in!
